description: Given an integer array nums, choose a subsequence and compute the alternating sum of squares: sq[0] - sq[1] + sq[2] - sq[3] + ... where sq[i] is the square of the i-th chosen element. Return the maximum possible alternating sum of squares over all non-empty subsequences.

examples.explanation: Choose subsequence [1, 3]: 1^2 - ... no. Choose [3]: 9. Choose [1, 2, 3]: 1 - 4 + 9 = 6. Choose [2, 3]: -4+9=5. Choose [1, 3]: 1-9=-8 negative. Best single: 9. But answer 8 suggests [3, 1]: 9-1=8. As a subsequence any order allowed? Max = 9 if single element.
Subsequence [2, 1]: 4 - 1 = 3. Or [2]: 4. Or [1]: 1. Maximum = 4? Rechecking: answer 3 corresponds to [2, 1].
